summary: The Border Patrol Supervisors Retention Act aims to expand eligibility for special overtime pay for U.S. Border Patrol agents. It amends section 5550(h) of title 5 of the United States Code, specifically changing the eligibility criteria to include agents classified from grade GS–12 through GS–15. The bill's intention is to increase overtime pay for Border Patrol agents, particularly those in supervisory roles, with the aim of helping retain them.
